page.title: 01North Waltham and dummer
page.content: An area of attractive, undulating countryside 6 miles S W of Basingstoke, Hampshire. Contains 2 small villages divided by A.30 and M3 Motorway. North Waltham is picturesque village, population approx 600. Centre has duckpond surrounded by old, thatched cottages. Has primary school serving 3 villages, anglican and methodist churches post office and 2 pubs. Several local farms and an agricultural merchant employ a few local people but most commute to basingstoke, winchester, London. Farms in area produce beef, pigs and poultry but are mostly arable. Village organizations e.g. scouts, guides, women institute provide entertainment; Cuckoo meadow is recreation ground for local activities. dummer is smaller village, population 300, has post office/general store, church, pub and
